title: Israel launches 620-mln-USD plan to help self-employed, small business owners through COVID-19 crisis
content:
JERUSALEM, Jan. 4 (Xinhua) -- The Israeli government has approved a program to help self-employed and small and medium-sized business owners deal with the COVID-19 crisis, the Ministry of Finance and the Prime Minister's Office said in a joint statement on Monday.
The new program, which will cost more than 2 billion new shekels (620 million U.S. dollars), follows similar previous ones launched by the government since the outbreak of the coronavirus crisis in the country in late February 2020.
Dubbed From Blocking to Growth, the program includes grants for businesses affected by the crisis, especially during the ongoing third nationwide lockdown, up to 50,000 shekels, depending on the percentage of losses in the business turnover.
It also includes a refund of property taxes paid by businesses to local authorities.
"The money will immediately make it easier for businesses and within a short time we will open the entire economy and we will emerge from the crisis once and for all," said Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. Enditem
